head.title: In Quest of Help for the Autistic

hedline.hl1: In Quest of Help for the Autistic

abstract.p: Maria Hrabowski letter on May 6 article urges federal pressure on states and school districts to provide special education programs for autistic pupils

block.p: Re ''High Rewards and High Costs as States Draw Autistic Pupils'' (front page, May 6):

Instead of complaining about the financial burden brought by parents' quest for appropriate programs for their special children, we should complain about those states and school districts that, by not providing quality special education, uproot families with disabled children.
Re ''High Rewards and High Costs as States Draw Autistic Pupils'' (front page, May 6):

Instead of complaining about the financial burden brought by parents' quest for appropriate programs for their special children, we should complain about those states and school districts that, by not providing quality special education, uproot families with disabled children.

Moving from state to state not only adds additional stress to an already difficult life but also means leaving behind friends and relatives at the time when they are needed most. The federal government should try to bring some balance both by providing more money and holding all states accountable for the effects of their special education programs.
